## A Brief Introduction

For a while now i have been trying to express my thoughs in a shareable media. I ran around circles trying to figure out which technology should i use, but that was more of an excuse to avoid actually sitting and taking the time to write. Writing is not something that comes naturally to me, but i do think is the ultimate medium to express ideas and share them with others. So this is the start of what i hope would be a nice adventure into my own thoughts and ideas.



### A Nice Figure

Tet's see if we can add a nice figure to this post.

```{python}
#| label: fig-polar
#| fig-cap: "A line plot on a polar axis"

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()
```

### An Interactive Plot

What if we want the nice graph to be interactive?

```{python}
#| label: fig-interactive
#| fig-cap: "An interactive plot"
#| code-fold: false
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.io as pio
df = px.data.iris()
fig = px.scatter(df, x="sepal_width", y="sepal_length",             # <1>
                 color="species",                                  # <1>
                 marginal_y="violin", marginal_x="box",            # <1>
                 trendline="ols", template="simple_white")         # <1>
fig.show()
```

### A Wider Figure

```{python}
#| label: fig-wide
#| fig-cap: "A wide figure"
#| column: page
#| code-fold: false


import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plotly/datasets/master/earthquakes-23k.csv')

import plotly.express as px
fig = px.density_mapbox(df, lat='Latitude', lon='Longitude', z='Magnitude', radius=10,
                        center=dict(lat=0, lon=180), zoom=0,
                        mapbox_style="open-street-map")
fig.show()
```
